briefdescription.para: Indicates the format supports unordered loads.
[DEPRECATED] no mipmapping
point mipmapping
linear mipmapping
MipMapMode enum class.
[DEPRECATED]
point sampling
linear sampling
[DEPRECATED] anisotropic and similar, if available
point comparasion for using in pcf
FilterMode enum class.
Repeats the texture when texture coordinates are outside [0, 1].
Mirrors the texture when texture coordinates are outside [0, 1].
Clamps texture coordinates to [0, 1].
Uses the border color when texture coordinates are outside [0, 1].

detaileddescription.para: Similar to Mirror and Clamp. Takes the absolute value of the texture coordinate (thus, mirroring around 0), and then clamps to the maximum value. The most common usage is for volume textures, where support for the full MirrorOnce texture-addressing mode is not necessary, but the data is symmetrical around the one axis.

briefdescription.para: AddressMode enum class.
Opaque type, a pointer to which represents an event query.
Matches to true when the current platform is \xbone and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform is \scarlett and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform is \ios and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform is \tvos and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform is \nswitch and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform is \android and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform is \mac and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform is \linux and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform is \win32 and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current driver is \dx11 and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current driver is \dx12 and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current driver is \vk and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform / driver is \ps4 and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current platform / driver is \ps5 and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current driver is \metal and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current driver is null and otherwise false.
Matches to true when the current driver is stub and otherwise false.
Matches true when either \xbone or \scarlett matches true, otherwise false.
Matches true when either \ps4 or \ps5 matches true, otherwise false.
Matches true when either \mac, \linux or \win32 matches true, otherwise false.

detaileddescription.para:
Matches true when no driver could be matched, otherwise false.
On platforms with a fixed driver, this will always match false.

briefdescription.para: Matches always true, has special meaning for some uses, like map.
Matches true when either \ios, \tvos or \mac matches true, otherwise false.
Matches true when the build of the project targets a 32 bit architecture.
Matches true when the build of the project targets a 64 bit architecture.
Shader model constant that represents no shader model.
Version constant of the 4.0 shader model.
Version constant of the 4.1 shader model.
Version constant of the 5.0 shader model.
Version constant of the 6.0 shader model.
Version constant of the 6.6 shader model.
Version constant that will match true to any shader model version.
Latest supported shader model version of the list defined by shadermodel::AllVersionsList.
Earliest supported shader model version of the list defined by shadermodel::AllVersionsList.

detaileddescription.para: This value is a version range over all listed versions, to extend the list, alter the type d3d::shadermodel::AllVersionsList. This value supports begin / end and can be used as a range for range based for loops.

briefdescription.para: Registers a sampler into the global bindless sampler table.

detaileddescription.para: Multiple register calls with the same sampler may yield identical return values. Default sampler (mip linear, filter linear, address wrap, anisotropic = 1, mip bias = 0, transparent black border) is available at zero slot by default.

parameterdescription.para: Sampler that should be added.

simplesect.para: Index in the global sampler table representing this sampler.

briefdescription.para: Allocates a persistent bindless slot range of the given 'type' resource type.

parameterdescription.para: The type of resource to allocate the slot range for.
The number of slots to allocate. Must be larger than 0.

simplesect.para: The first slot index into the bindless heap of the requested range.

memberdef.argsstring: (D3DResourceType type, uint32_t index, uint32_t current_count, uint32_t new_count)
memberdef.name: resize_bindless_resource_range

briefdescription.para: Resizes a previously allocated bindless slot range.

detaileddescription.para: It can shrink and enlarge a slot range. The contents of all slots of the old range are migrated to the new range, so only new entries have to be updated.

parameterdescription.para: The type of resource to resize the slot range for.
The index of the slot range to resize. Must be in a previously allocated bindless range, or any value if 'current_count' is 0.
The current count of slots in the range. Must be within a previously allocated bindless slot range or 0, when 0 then it behaves like 'allocate_bindless_resource_range'.
The new count of slots in the range. Can be larger or smaller than 'current_count', shrinks or enlarges the slot range accordingly.

simplesect.para: The first slot of the new range.

briefdescription.para: Frees a previously allocated slot range.

detaileddescription.para: This can also be used to shrink ranges, similarly to 'resize_bindless_resource_range'.

parameterdescription.para: The type of resource to free the slot range for.
The index of the slot range to free. Must be in a previously allocated bindless range, or any value if 'count' is 0.
The number of slots to free. Must not exceed the previously allocated bindless slot range. Can be 0 which will be a no-op.

briefdescription.para: Updates a given bindless slot with the reference to 'res'.

detaileddescription.para: The slot has to be allocated previously with the corresponding allocation methods with 'type' matching the getType() of 'res'.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the bindless slot to update. Must be in a previously allocated bindless range.
The type of resource range to update with res.
Pointer to the D3dResource object.

simplesect.para: true if actual update is occurred, or false if internal cache was used

briefdescription.para: Updates one or more bindless slots with a "null" resource of the given type.

detaileddescription.para: Shader access to those slots will read all zeros and writes will be discarded.

parameterdescription.para: The type of resource to update with null.
The index of the bindless slot to update. Must be in a previously allocated bindless range.
The number of slots to update. Must not exceed the previously allocated bindless slot range.

memberdef.argsstring: (int struct_size, int elements, unsigned flags, unsigned texfmt, const char *name)
memberdef.name: create_sbuffer

briefdescription.para: Creates a buffer with the specified parameters.

detaileddescription.para: The buffer can be used for various purposes, such as constant buffers, structured buffers, byte address buffers, and more. It is an uber method, and not all combinations of parameters are valid. Use d3d::buffers namespace for more specific buffer creation methods.

parameterdescription.para: The size of each structure in the buffer.
The number of elements in the buffer.
Additional flags for the buffer.
The texture format for tBuffers.
The name of the buffer.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the created buffer.

briefdescription.para: Sets an Sbuffer for a specific shader stage and slot.

parameterdescription.para: The shader stage to set the buffer for. One of STAGE_ values.
The slot to bind the buffer to.
A pointer to the Sbuffer to set.

simplesect.para: True if the buffer was successfully set, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets a read-write Sbuffer for a specific shader stage and slot.

parameterdescription.para: The shader stage to set the buffer for. One of STAGE_ values.
The slot to bind the buffer to.
A pointer to the Sbuffer to set.

simplesect.para: True if the buffer was successfully set, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Starts the capture process. All previous outstanding commands will be flushed.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the capture. This might show up in the capture tool or be used in the filename depending on platform and the capture tool used. nullptr is not allowed.
The path where the captured file will be saved. Not all capture tools respect this. nullptr means default path is used.

simplesect.para: true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Stops the ongoing capture process.

detaileddescription.para: This function halts any active capture operation that is currently in progress. Commands made since the last call to start_capture() will be flushed.

briefdescription.para: send specific command to driver

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t thread_group_x, uint32_t thread_group_y, uint32_t thread_group_z, GpuPipeline gpu_pipeline=GpuPipeline::GRAPHICS)
memberdef.name: dispatch

briefdescription.para: Dispatches a compute shader with the specified thread group dimensions.

parameterdescription.para: The number of thread groups in the X dimension.
The number of thread groups in the Y dimension.
The number of thread groups in the Z dimension.
The GPU pipeline to use for dispatching (default: GpuPipeline::GRAPHICS).

simplesect.para: gpu_pipeline argument doesn't work currently.
True if the dispatch was successful, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Dispatches a compute shader indirectly using the specified argument buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The argument buffer containing the dispatch parameters. The buffer must be created with the d3d::buffers::create_indirect or d3d::buffers::create_ua_indirect methods and Indirect::Dispatch argument. The buffer should contain the following data: uint32_t thread_group_x, uint32_t thread_group_y, uint32_t thread_group_z.
The byte offset within the argument buffer (default: 0).
The GPU pipeline to use for dispatching (default: GpuPipeline::GRAPHICS).

simplesect.para: gpu_pipeline argument doesn't work currently.
True if the dispatch was successful, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Dispatches a mesh shader with the specified thread group dimensions.

detaileddescription.para: Max value for each direction is 64k, product of all dimensions can not exceed 2^22

parameterdescription.para: The number of thread groups in the X direction.
The number of thread groups in the Y direction.
The number of thread groups in the Z direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (Sbuffer *args, uint32_t dispatch_count, uint32_t stride_bytes, uint32_t byte_offset=0)
memberdef.name: dispatch_mesh_indirect

briefdescription.para: Dispatches a mesh shader indirectly using the provided arguments.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer containing the dispatch arguments. Buffer should contain structures of the following layout: struct DispatchArgs { uint32_t thread_group_x; uint32_t thread_group_y; uint32_t thread_group_z; };
The number of dispatches to execute.
The stride between dispatch arguments in bytes.
The byte offset into the buffer where the dispatch arguments start (default = 0).

memberdef.argsstring: (Sbuffer *args, uint32_t args_stride_bytes, uint32_t args_byte_offset, Sbuffer *count, uint32_t count_byte_offset, uint32_t max_count)
memberdef.name: dispatch_mesh_indirect_count

briefdescription.para: Dispatches a mesh shader indirectly using the provided arguments and a count buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Variant of dispatch_mesh_indirect where 'dispatch_count' is read by the GPU from 'count' buffer at 'count_offset' (as uint32_t), this value can not exceed 'max_count'.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer containing the dispatch arguments.
The stride between dispatch arguments in bytes.
The byte offset into the buffer where the dispatch arguments start.
The buffer containing the dispatch count.
The byte offset into the count buffer where the dispatch count starts.
The maximum value that the dispatch count can have.

briefdescription.para: initalizes 3d device driver
returns true when d3d API is inited

memberdef.argsstring: (void *hinst, main_wnd_f *, const char *wcname, int ncmdshow, void *&mainwnd, void *renderwnd, void *hicon, const char *title, Driver3dInitCallback *cb)
memberdef.name: init_video

detaileddescription.para: start up, read cfg, create window, init 3d hard&soft, ... if renderwnd!=NULL, mainwnd and renderwnd are used for rendering (when possible) on error, returns false on sucess, return true

briefdescription.para: shutdown driver and release all resources
fills function-pointers table for d3d API, or returns false if unsupported
notify driver before window destruction
notify driver on window destruction

detaileddescription.para: returns true when device is lost; when it is safe to reset device can_reset_now is set with 1 returns false when device is ok

briefdescription.para: performs device reset; returns true if succeded

detaileddescription.para: flip video pages or copy to screen frame_id is used to track the frame number for low latency sleep calculation app_active==false is hint to the driver returns false on error

briefdescription.para: If the update_screen(bool) works asynchronously then under certain conditions it will block the execution until the previously called update_screen(bool) is finished.

parameterdescription.para: Even if the internal conditions don't require the wait, the execution will wait for the present to finish

briefdescription.para: Marks the start of a new frame. Additionally it blocks the execution until the GPU finishes on going render task for delaying the input sampling and using the most recent user inputs for rendering the next frame.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the frame to be started. It is expected to be a monotonically increasing value.
If true, the function will block the execution until the GPU finishes the ongoing render task. If false, the function will not block the execution and will return immediately.

detaileddescription.para: marks the start of simulation for the frame This is used to track the time spent in simulation for low latency sleep calculation

briefdescription.para: marks the end of simulation for the frame

detaileddescription.para: marks the start of render submission for the frame This is used to track the time spent in render submission for low latency sleep calculation

briefdescription.para: marks the end of render submission for the frame

detaileddescription.para: capture screen to buffer.fast, but not guaranteed many captures can be followed by only one end_fast_capture_screen()
capture screen to TexPixel32 buffer slow, and not 100% guaranted returns NULL on error

briefdescription.para: release buffer used to capture screen

detaileddescription.para: conditional rendering. conditional rendering is used to skip rendering of triangles completelyon GPU. the only commands, that would be ignored, if survey fails are DIPs (all commands and states will still be executed), so it is better to use reports to completely skip object rendering max index is defined per platform surveying.

briefdescription.para: returns current state of VSYNC
enables or disables strong VSYNC (flips only on VBLANK); returns true on success

simplesect.para: true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (int rt_index, BaseTexture *, int fc, uint8_t level)
memberdef.name: set_render_target

briefdescription.para: Sets the render target for rendering.

simplesect.para: if texture is depth texture format, it is the same as call set_depth() DON'T USE THIS BEHAVIOR!!!

xrefdescription.para: Use set_render_target(RenderTarget depth, DepthAccess depth_access, dag::ConstSpan<RenderTarget> colors) instead.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the render target. The maximum number of render targets is defined by Driver3dRenderTarget::MAX_SIMRT.
A pointer to the BaseTexture object representing the render target.

The face of the texture (for cube textures and texture arrays). If face is RENDER_TO_WHOLE_ARRAY, then the whole Texture Array/Volume Tex will be set as render target. This is to be used with geom shader (and Metal allows with vertex shader).
The level of the render target.

simplesect.para: True if the render target was set successfully, false otherwise.

The face of the texture (for cube textures and texture arrays). If face is RENDER_TO_WHOLE_ARRAY, then the whole Texture Array/Volume Tex will be set as render target. This is to be used with geom shader (and Metal allows with vertex shader).
The level of the render target.

briefdescription.para: Get the secondary backbuffer texture.

detaileddescription.para: Secondary backbuffer is only valid while the GPU is acquired, and can be recreated in between. It exists only for Xbox. Mostly used as a backbuffer with a higher resolution to draw UI.

simplesect.para: The secondary backbuffer texture.

memberdef.argsstring: (BaseTexture *dest_base_texture, unsigned dest_mip, unsigned dest_slice, unsigned offset_x, unsigned offset_y, unsigned offset_z, unsigned width, unsigned height, unsigned depth)
memberdef.name: allocate_update_buffer_for_tex_region

briefdescription.para: Allocates a update buffer to update the subregion described by offset_x, offset_y, offset_z, width, height and depth.

listitem.para: dest_mip must be a valid mipmap level for dest_base_texture
dest_slice must be a valid array index / cube face for dest_base_texture when it is a array, cube or cube array texture, otherwise has to be 0
offset_x must be within the width of dest_base_texture of miplevel dest_mip and aligned to the texture format block size
offset_y must be within the height of dest_base_texture of miplevel dest_mip and aligned to the texture format block size
offset_z must be within the depth of dest_base_texture of miplevel dest_mip when the texture is a vol tex, otherwise has to be 0
width plus offset_x must be within the width of dest_base_texture of miplevel dest_mip and aligned to the texture format block size
height plus offset_y must be within the height of dest_base_texture of miplevel dest_mip and aligned to the texture format block size
depth plus offset_z must be within the depth of dest_base_texture of miplevel dest_mip when the texture is a vol tex, otherwise has to be 1

detaileddescription.para:
May return nullptr if either inputs violate the rules above, the driver can currently not provide the memory required or the driver is unable to perform the needed copy operation on update.
Don't call it again for same region if the first call was successful. This may cause a data race.

briefdescription.para: Allocates update buffer in system memory to be filled directly and then dispatched to apply_tex_update_buffer.

simplesect.para: This method can fail if too much allocations happens in N-frame period. Caller should retry after rendering frame on screen if this happens.
Don't call it again for same mip or slice if the first call was successful. This may cause a data race.

parameterdescription.para: destination texture
destination mip level
destination slice

simplesect.para: pointer to update buffer or nullptr if allocation failed

briefdescription.para: Releases update buffer (clears pointer afterwards); skips any update, just releases data.

parameterdescription.para: update buffer to release

briefdescription.para: Returns data address to fill update data.

parameterdescription.para: update buffer

simplesect.para: pointer to memory that should be filled with data

briefdescription.para: Returns size of update buffer.

parameterdescription.para: update buffer

simplesect.para: size of update buffer in bytes

briefdescription.para: Returns pitch of update buffer (if applicable)

parameterdescription.para: update buffer

simplesect.para: pitch of update buffer

briefdescription.para: Returns the pitch of one 2d image slice for volumetric textures.

parameterdescription.para: update buffer

simplesect.para: pitch of of a slice in the update buffer

briefdescription.para: applies update to target d3dres and releases update buffer (clears pointer afterwards)

parameterdescription.para: update buffer to apply

simplesect.para: true if update was successful, false if update failed

Creates a sampler, when necessary. Identical infos should yield identical handles. This call is thread-safe and does not require external synchronization.

SamplerHandle The handle to the sampler

memberdef.name: create_program

briefdescription.para: Creates a program with a vertex shader, fragment shader, and vertex declaration.

detaileddescription.para:
vprog
The vertex shader program.
fsh
The fragment shader program.
vdecl
The vertex declaration.
strides
The stride values for each vertex stream (optional, default is 0).
streams
The number of vertex streams (optional, default is 0).
The created program.
If strides and streams are not set, they will be obtained from the vertex declaration. The program should be deleted externally using delete_program().

briefdescription.para: Sets immediate constants for the specified stage.

detaileddescription.para: Immediate constants are supposed to be very cheap to set dwords. It is guaranteed to support up to 4 dwords on each stage. Use as little as possible, ideally one or two (or none). On XB1(PS4), it is implemented as user regs (C|P|V)SSetShaderUserData. On DX11, it is implemented as constant buffers. On VK/DX12, it should be implemented as descriptor/push constants buffers. Calling with data = nullptr || num_words == 0 is benign and currently works as "stop using immediate" (probably have to be replaced with shader system).

parameterdescription.para: The shader stage (STAGE_VS, STAGE_PS, STAGE_CS).
Pointer to the data to be set.
The number of words to be set.

simplesect.para: True if the constants were set successfully, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned stage, unsigned slot, const float *data, unsigned num_regs)
memberdef.name: set_const_buffer

briefdescription.para: Sets a constant buffer for the specified stage. PS4 specific.

detaileddescription.para: Constant buffers are valid until driver acquire call or end of frame. To unbind, use set_const_buffer(stage, 0, nullptr).

parameterdescription.para: The shader stage (STAGE_VS, STAGE_PS, STAGE_CS).
The buffer slot.
Pointer to the data to be set. The size must be a multiple of sizeof(float4).
The number of registers (float4) to be set.

simplesect.para: True if the constant buffer was set successfully, false otherwise.
When slot is 0, and data is not nullptr, it will also override any constants set via set_const and related calls.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned stage, unsigned slot, Sbuffer *buffer, uint32_t consts_offset=0, uint32_t consts_size=0)
memberdef.name: set_const_buffer

briefdescription.para: Sets a constant buffer for the specified stage using a buffer object.

detaileddescription.para: Constant buffers are valid until driver acquire call or end of frame. To unbind, use set_const_buffer(stage, 0, nullptr).

parameterdescription.para: The shader stage (STAGE_VS, STAGE_PS, STAGE_CS).
The buffer slot.
Pointer to the buffer object. Must be created with d3d::buffers::create_persistent_cb or d3d::buffers::create_one_frame_cb.
The offset of the constants in the buffer. (Not used)
The size of the constants in the buffer. (Not used)

xrefdescription.para: consts_offset and consts_size are not used. Remove them?

simplesect.para: True if the constant buffer was set successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the size of the vertex shader constant buffer that can be filled with set_const call.

parameterdescription.para: The required size of the constant buffer. If 0, the default size is set.

simplesect.para: The actual size of the constant buffer.

briefdescription.para: Sets the size of the compute shader constant buffer that can be filled with set_const call.

parameterdescription.para: The required size of the constant buffer. If 0, the default size is set.

simplesect.para: The actual size of the constant buffer.

briefdescription.para: Sets a constant buffer at slot 0 for the specified stage. Uses the fastest method available on the platform.

detaileddescription.para: Constant buffers are valid until driver acquire call or end of frame. To unbind, use release_cb0_data(stage).

parameterdescription.para: The shader stage (STAGE_VS, STAGE_PS, STAGE_CS).
Pointer to the data to be set. The size must be a multiple of sizeof(float4).
The number of registers (float4) to be set.

simplesect.para: True if the constants were set successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Releases the constant buffer at slot 0, which should have been previously set by set_cb0_data.

parameterdescription.para: The shader stage (STAGE_VS, STAGE_PS, STAGE_CS).

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new shader library. The creation of a shader library may be a time consuming process (several hundred milliseconds) as device drivers compile the generic shader IL into device specific machine code, this function will block until this process is completed. Returns either a new ShaderLibrary object or InvalidShaderLibrary to indicate there was and error. In case of an error, driver should log the cause for the error into the error log. In case of a device reset, the shader library becomes unusable and has to be destroyed and recreated.
Destroys a shader library. A shader library can be destroyed when other object reference shaders of the shader library.

Returns the "<major>.<minor>" string representation of a Version value that is part of d3d::smAny. v Version for which string it should be returned.
A valid constant string for versions included in d3d::smAny.

Returns the "<major>.<minor>" string representation of a VersionWithName value. v Version for which string it should be returned.
versionName member of v.

Returns the "ps<major><minor>" string representation of a Version value that is part of d3d::smAny. v Version for which string it should be returned.
A valid constant string for versions included in d3d::smAny.

Returns the "ps<major><minor>" string representation of a VersionWithName value. v Version for which string it should be returned.
psName member of v.

briefdescription.para: Sets the stream output buffer for the next draw calls.

detaileddescription.para:
slot
The stream output slot index (slot is limited by MAX_STREAM_OUTPUT_SLOTS).
buffer
The stream output slot description.
Note that you have to reset the stream output buffer to null after the needed draw calls.
It is invalid to call this when DeviceDriverCapabilities::hasStreamOutput feature is not supported.
Stream output requires to ship DXIL on Xbox which will increase bindump size and pipelines creation time. Minimize amount of such pipelines since it is very expensive on Xbox!

simplesect.para: Returns true if the two texture creation flags result in the same format, otherwise returns false.

briefdescription.para: Check whether the specified volume texture format is available.

simplesect.para: Returns false if a volume texture of the specified format cannot be created, otherwise returns true.

memberdef.argsstring: (BaseTexture *baseTexture, TexImage32 *img, int w, int h, int flg, int levels, const char *stat_name=nullptr)
memberdef.name: alias_tex

briefdescription.para: Create a texture alias, a texture using the same memory as another texture but with different properties. The alias may use a different resolution, format or mip level, subject to restrictions below.

simplesect.para: You also must dispatch a RB_ALIAS_FROM/RB_ALIAS_TO barrier after you stop using one of the aliases and before you start using a different alias, where all textures occupying the same memory are considered to be aliases of each other.
After switching to a new alias, it will contain garbage and will need to be initialized. This API does NOT guarantee data inheritance whatsoever. It is to be used for memory reuse only.

It is not guaranteed that an intuitively smaller alias can be created from a bigger texture. Decreasing the resolution by several pixels causes the amount of memory needed to store the texture to INCREASE on some platforms for some formats and some concrete resolutions. Hence, this function CAN fail and will return nullptr and logerr in such a case. Use d3d::get_resource_allocation_properties to check whether the alias will not take up more memory than the original texture before calling this API.

xrefdescription.para: Always prefer higher-level APIs for saving memory (e.g. frame graph, ResizableTex). Avoid using this as much as possible, it will be removed in favor of using heaps via a frame graph system.

parameterdescription.para: The base texture to alias.
32-bit image data.
The width of the texture.
The height of the texture.
The texture creation flags.
The maximum number of mipmap levels.
The name of the texture for statistics purposes (optional).

simplesect.para: A pointer to the created texture alias, or nullptr on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (BaseTexture *baseTexture, int size, int flg, int levels, const char *stat_name=nullptr)
memberdef.name: alias_cubetex

briefdescription.para: Create a cube texture alias, a texture using the same memory as another cube texture but with a different format.

parameterdescription.para: The base cube texture to alias.
The size of the texture.
The texture creation flags.
The maximum number of mipmap levels.
The name of the texture for statistics purposes (optional).

simplesect.para: A pointer to the created cube texture alias, or nullptr on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (BaseTexture *baseTexture, int w, int h, int d, int flg, int levels, const char *stat_name=nullptr)

parameterdescription.para: The base volume texture to alias.
The width of the texture.
The height of the texture.
The depth of the texture.
The texture creation flags.
The maximum number of mipmap levels.
The name of the texture for statistics purposes (optional).

simplesect.para: A pointer to the created volume texture alias, or nullptr on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (BaseTexture *baseTexture, int w, int h, int d, int flg, int levels, const char *stat_name)

parameterdescription.para: The base texture2d array to alias.
The width of the texture.
The height of the texture.
Amount of textures in the array.
The texture creation flags.
The maximum number of mipmap levels.
The name of the texture for statistics purposes (optional).

simplesect.para: A pointer to the created texture2d array alias, or nullptr on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (BaseTexture *baseTexture, int side, int d, int flg, int levels, const char *stat_name)
memberdef.name: alias_cube_array_tex

briefdescription.para: Create a cube array texture alias, a texture using the same memory as another cube array texture but with a different format.

parameterdescription.para: The base cube array texture to alias.
The side of the cube texture.
Amount of textures in the array.
The texture creation flags.
The maximum number of mipmap levels.
The name of the texture for statistics purposes (optional).

simplesect.para: A pointer to the created cube array texture alias, or nullptr on error.

briefdescription.para: Stretch a rectangle from the source texture to the destination texture.

detaileddescription.para: Under the hood it is a call of CopySubresourceRegion if source and destination textures are the same type and their texel could be mapped one to one. Otherwise it is an execution of a shader that does the stretching.

parameterdescription.para: The source texture.
The destination texture.
The source rectangle (optional).
The destination rectangle (optional).

simplesect.para: Returns true if the stretch operation was successful, otherwise returns false.

briefdescription.para: Get the texture statistics.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store the number of textures.
Pointer to store the total memory used by textures.
Pointer to store the texture statistics dump.

briefdescription.para: Set a texture for a shader stage and slot.

parameterdescription.para: The shader stage. One of the STAGE_XXX flags.
The slot.
The texture to set.

simplesect.para: Returns true if the texture was successfully set, otherwise returns false.

briefdescription.para: Set a texture for a pixel shader slot.

parameterdescription.para: The slot.
The texture to set.

simplesect.para: Returns true if the texture was successfully set, otherwise returns false.

briefdescription.para: Set a texture for a vertex shader slot.

parameterdescription.para: The slot.
The texture to set.

simplesect.para: Returns true if the texture was successfully set, otherwise returns false.

briefdescription.para: Discard the texture. It initializes the texture leaving the texels in an undefined state.

parameterdescription.para: Texture to discard. Now usage is limited to UA and RT textures only.

simplesect.para: true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Maps a memory area of the heap to the specified xyz location of the texture.

detaileddescription.para: Use heap == nullptr to remove the link between a tile and the mapped heap portion.

parameterdescription.para: The texture to map.
The heap to map.
The mapping to apply.
The number of mappings in the mapping array.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the tiling information of a texture.

parameterdescription.para: The texture to query.
The index of the subresource.

simplesect.para: The tiling information of the texture.

briefdescription.para: Sets variable rate shading setup for next draw calls.

simplesect.para: Rates (rate_x, rate_y) of 1 by 4 or 4 by 1 are invalid.
Depth/Stencil values are always computed at full rate and so shaders that modify depth value output may interfere with the pixel_combiner.

parameterdescription.para: Constant rates for the next draw calls, those are supported by all VRS capable devices. Valid values for both are 1, 2 and with the corresponding feature cap 4.

The mode in which the constant rate of rate_x and rate_y is combined with a possible vertex/geometry shader rate output. For shader outputs see SV_ShadingRate, note that the provoking vertex or the per primitive value is used.
The mode in which the result of 'vertex_combiner' is combined with the rate of the sampling rate texture set by set_variable_rate_shading_texture.

briefdescription.para: Sets the variable rate shading texture for the next draw calls.

detaileddescription.para:
rate_texture
The texture to use as a shading rate source.
Note that when you start to modify the used texture, you should reset the used shading rate texture to null to ensure that on next use as a shading rate source, the texture is in a state the device can use.
It is invalid to call this when DeviceDriverCapabilities::hasVariableRateShadingTexture feature is not supported.

briefdescription.para: Creates a vertex buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a vertex buffer with the specified size and flags.

parameterdescription.para: The size of the vertex buffer in bytes.
The creation flags.
The name of the vertex buffer (temporarily optional).

simplesect.para: A pointer to the created vertex buffer.

briefdescription.para: Creates an index buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates an index buffer with the specified size and flags.

parameterdescription.para: The size of the index buffer in bytes.
The creation flags.
The name of the index buffer (temporarily optional).

simplesect.para: A pointer to the created index buffer.

memberdef.argsstring: (int stream, Sbuffer *vb, int offset, int stride_bytes)
memberdef.name: setvsrc_ex

briefdescription.para: Sets the vertex buffer as a stream source.

detaileddescription.para: This function sets the vertex buffer as a stream source for the specified stream.

parameterdescription.para: The stream index.
A pointer to the vertex buffer.
The offset in bytes from the start of the vertex buffer.
The stride in bytes between vertices.

simplesect.para: True if the vertex stream source was set successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the vertex buffer as a stream source.

detaileddescription.para: This function sets the vertex buffer as a stream source for the specified stream.

parameterdescription.para: The stream index.
A pointer to the vertex buffer.
The stride in bytes between vertices.

simplesect.para: True if the vertex stream source was set successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the index buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This function sets the index buffer for rendering.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the index buffer.

simplesect.para: True if the indices were set successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Creates a DX8-style vertex declaration.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a DX8-style vertex declaration based on the specified vertex shader declaration.

xrefdescription.para: Do we really need to support DX8-style vertex declarations? Maybe it's time to look for a more modern solution.

parameterdescription.para: The vertex shader declaration.

simplesect.para: The created vertex declaration, or BAD_VDECL on error.

briefdescription.para: Deletes a vertex declaration.

detaileddescription.para: This function deletes a vertex declaration.

parameterdescription.para: The vertex declaration to delete.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current vertex declaration.

detaileddescription.para: This function sets the current vertex declaration for rendering.

parameterdescription.para: The vertex declaration to set.

simplesect.para: True if the vertex declaration was set successfully, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (int x, int y, int w, int h)
memberdef.name: setscissor

briefdescription.para: Set scissor for the current render target. Part of the render target that is outside the scissor rectangle is not rendered.

parameterdescription.para: - left corner of the scissor rectangle
- top corner of the scissor rectangle
- width of the scissor rectangle
- height of the scissor rectangle

simplesect.para: true if the scissor rectangle was set successfully

briefdescription.para: Set scissor for the current set of render targets. Part of the render target that is outside the scissor rectangle is not rendered.

parameterdescription.para: - array of scissor rectangles. Should be the same size as the number of render targets.

simplesect.para: true if the scissor rectangles were set successfully

memberdef.argsstring: (int x, int y, int w, int h, float minz, float maxz)
memberdef.name: setview

briefdescription.para: Set view for the current render target. Part of the render target that is outside the view rectangle is not rendered.

parameterdescription.para: - left corner of the view rectangle
- top corner of the view rectangle
- width of the view rectangle
- height of the view rectangle
- minimum depth value of the view rectangle
- maximum depth value of the view rectangle

simplesect.para: true if the view rectangle was set successfully

briefdescription.para: Set view for the current set of render targets. Part of the render target that is outside the view rectangle is not rendered.

parameterdescription.para: - array of view rectangles. Should be the same size as the number of render targets.

simplesect.para: true if the view rectangles were set successfully

briefdescription.para: Get view for the current render target.

xrefdescription.para: Don't use it since this method relies on the global state.

parameterdescription.para: - left corner of the view rectangle
- top corner of the view rectangle
- width of the view rectangle
- height of the view rectangle
- minimum depth value of the view rectangle
- maximum depth value of the view rectangle

simplesect.para: true if the view rectangle was retrieved successfully
